Description: Corroded iron item in the shape of a thick hook with a narrow gap and a curved tapering point, certainly for suspension and not for fishing. The attachment loop or eye at the other end seems partly broken and missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Possibly from the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: Possibly the "hook" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 78, part of the "large quantity of iron scraps, apparently a workman's scrap heap (...) found in the camp".
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 78) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.77, p.185, pl.27)
